author: SCIENMAG
title: Ancient Texts Decoded by Neural Networks
text:
In a groundbreaking fusion of ancient history and cutting-edge artificial intelligence, researchers have unveiled Aeneas, a sophisticated machine learning model designed to revolutionize the study of Latin inscriptions. This technological marvel aims to assist historians by restoring fragmented texts, dating undocumented carvings, and pinpointing their geographic origins within the vast expanse of the Roman Empire. The advent of Aeneas heralds a new era for digital humanities, where deep learning meets millennia-old stone, unearthing insights previously buried under the patina of time.
The impetus for Aeneas stems from recent strides in machine learning, particularly the proliferation of transformer architectures, which have excelled in natural language processing. Unlike conventional approaches that often rely on rigid rule-based systems or manual curation, Aeneas integrates both textual data and visual imagery, harnessing a multimodal framework that taps into the physicality of inscriptions. This allows the system to engage with nuances such as the carving style, material wear, and layout‚Äîfactors that are crucial in epigraphic interpretation.
Central to Aeneas‚Äôs success is the Latin Epigraphic Dataset (LED), meticulously compiled from leading epigraphic repositories including the Epigraphic Database Roma (EDR), Epigraphic Database Heidelberg (EDH), and the Electronic Archive of Greek and Latin Epigraphy (EDCS_ETL). This formidable dataset encompasses over 16 million characters sourced from inscriptions spanning an extensive timeline, approximately 800 BCE to 800 CE, and covering diverse Roman provinces. The careful curation involved normalizing metadata, standardizing ancient provincial nomenclature, and retaining the original epigraphic conventions, such as editors‚Äô restoration brackets and placeholders for missing characters, to preserve historical authenticity and challenge the model‚Äôs learning capacity.
Importantly, the dataset also includes a limited but representative selection of inscription images. These visual data underwent rigorous preprocessing, including the exclusion of non-photographic artefacts, the removal of blurry frames using Laplacian variance analysis, and conversion to greyscale, ensuring uniformity suitable for deep learning. However, only about 5% of textual inscriptions are accompanied by images, presenting limitations that highlight the scarcity of multimodal epigraphic data, a bottleneck that Aeneas‚Äôs creators aim to alleviate with future dataset expansions.
Aeneas is architected to undertake four principal epigraphic tasks: fixed-length text restoration, restoration of missing sequences with unknown length, geographical attribution, and chronological dating. To do this, it processes sequences up to 768 characters long, marked with placeholder symbols denoting absent or uncertain text portions, and pairs these with corresponding inscription images. The model‚Äôs transformer-based design enables it to capture both linguistic context and subtle visual cues, such as inscriptive style or stone type, thereby enhancing its predictive accuracy beyond traditional text-only analyses.
Notably, the system confronts the challenge of editorial circularity, a phenomenon in which previous human restorations‚Äîespecially the expansion of abbreviations and speculative text restorations‚Äîmight inadvertently bias model training. While expansions were removed from the dataset to avoid outright replication of editorial interpolations, conjectured restorations marked by square brackets were retained to maximize the quantity of learning material. Trials showed that excluding these conjectures diminished model performance, indicating that including carefully curbed editorial input strikes a balance between dataset richness and bias mitigation.
Beyond raw algorithmic prowess, Aeneas boasts a contextualization mechanism that retrieves historically and linguistically relevant parallel inscriptions, serving as a research assistant that extends beyond mere pattern matching. An extensive historian‚ÄìAI evaluation involving 23 epigraphers validated this feature: participants found that Aeneas‚Äôs suggested parallels dramatically reduced the time taken to identify contextual analogues from days to mere minutes, facilitating more profound and nuanced historical interpretations. The experts reported significant increases in confidence‚Äîup to nearly 70%‚Äîwhen equipped with Aeneas‚Äôs parallels and predictive suggestions, underscoring its potential as a collaborative tool complementing expert judgment.
However, Aeneas is not without constraints. Its effectiveness correlates strongly with the data density of specific regions and periods. For example, the model excels in attributing inscriptions from central Roman provinces such as Roma and Africa Proconsularis due to abundant high-quality data. Conversely, regions like Sicily and Sardinia, where inscriptions are sparse and data coverage is patchy, exhibit notably decreased attribution accuracy. Furthermore, the model‚Äôs ability to date inscriptions peaks around 200 CE, aligning with a historically prolific phase of Latin epigraphy and rich dataset representation, while earlier periods with scarcer and less precisely dated texts yield more ambiguous results.
The model‚Äôs multimodal approach also ushers in novel investigative avenues beyond textual analysis. Image saliency maps reveal that Aeneas leverages architectural and iconographic elements, such as altar shapes or carving techniques, to substantiate its geographical predictions. This capacity to incorporate visual context mimics expert epigraphers‚Äô archaeological acumen, enabling the model to identify subtler markers of provenance that escape pure linguistic scrutiny. Such integrations hint at the transformative potential of combining AI with traditional epigraphic methodologies.
One illustrative case study involves an inscribed limestone altar dedicated to the Deae Aufaniae in Germania superior, dating to 211 CE. Aeneas accurately restores missing text fragments, assigns precise chronological dates within tight brackets, and situates the inscription geographically with remarkable precision. Moreover, through its parallel retrieval function, the model identifies related altars and formulaic expressions spanning contiguous Roman provinces, emulating and extending human scholarly insight. This exemplifies how Aeneas can uncover epigraphic networks and shared cultural practices previously obscured by fragmented or dispersed evidence.
Beyond research, Aeneas is paving the way for educational innovation. Collaborations with educational institutions in Belgium have produced curricula integrating Aeneas as a pedagogical tool, enabling high school and university students to engage directly with ancient Latin inscriptions mediated by AI. This approach cultivates digital literacy alongside classical scholarship, aligned with contemporary frameworks such as the European Digital Competence Framework and UNESCO‚Äôs AI competency standards, fostering critical engagement with both AI technologies and historical sources.
Looking ahead, the team behind Aeneas envisions enriching its capabilities via integration with large-scale dialogue models. Such enhancements could facilitate interactive research workflows, allowing historians to query the system dynamically and receive transparent, explainable insights. The researchers also highlight the need for improved methods to handle chronological uncertainty inherent in ancient data, advocating for evaluation metrics that accommodate variable date ranges rather than rigid point estimates.
Fundamental to the project‚Äôs ethos is an ethical commitment. Recognizing the risk of AI reinforcing biases or misclassifying sensitive historical contexts, the developers stress the indispensability of human oversight and caution against blind reliance on automated interpretations. Their interdisciplinary collaboration espouses responsible AI deployment, championing tools that augment rather than replace the nuanced judgment of humanities scholars, and emphasize inclusivity by highlighting epigraphy‚Äôs potential to illuminate marginalized voices in the ancient world.
In sum, Aeneas stands as a landmark achievement at the intersection of artificial intelligence and historical inquiry. Through sophisticated multimodal learning, expansive datasets, and human-centric evaluations, it charts a transformative path for epigraphy and ancient studies. By marrying the computational rigor of machine learning with the interpretive subtleties of scholarly expertise, Aeneas exemplifies how AI can deepen our dialogue with the past, unlocking the silent stories etched in stone through the ages.

title: Fine settimana con il sole, soprattutto al Centro-Sud | G. di Vicenza
text: ROMA, 12 OTT - Dopo la pioggia dei giorni scorsi torna il sole e promette un fine settimana di bel tempo, soprattutto al Centro-Sud. E' l'inzio di una fase di alta pressione che dovrebbe inaugurare la prossima settimana. Lo indicano le previsioni del meteorologo Mattia Gussoni, del sito iLMeteo.it. "Nelle prossime ore avremo prevalenza di sole", si legge nella nota, mentre a Nord "il cielo sar√† pi√π nuvoloso su Piemonte poi su Liguria, Valle d'Aosta e Lombardia occidentale; dal pomeriggio qualche addensamento non √® escluso anche su Appennini, Alpi orientali ed Alta Toscana. Altrove il sole sar√† dominante e le temperature massime saranno gradevoli: al Nord tra i 18¬∞C e i 23¬∞C, al Centro tra i 21¬∞C e i 25¬∞C, al Sud tra i 23¬∞C e i 28¬∞C". Cielo sereno e sole sulla maggior parte delle regioni sono previsti anche per domenica 13 ottobre, "salvo nubi medio-basse su Piemonte meridionale e Friuli Venezia Giulia, specie al mattino. Durante tutto il weekend non sono attese precipitazioni se non qualche piovasco sabato su Valle d'Aosta, Alto Piemonte, Alta Lombardia e Liguria". Una situazione simile si annuncia anche per la prossima settimana, prosegue il meteorologo, con tempo "piuttosto stabile e soleggiato quasi ovunque". E' comuque atteso pe rluned√¨ "un aumento della nuvolosit√† sul settentrione con la possibilit√† di isolata pioviggine, pi√π probabile al Nord-Ovest". In generale si profila sull'Italia un periodo di alta pressione, "circondato a destra e sinistra da due zone cicloniche, una sulla Spagna ed una sulla Turchia". Nel dettaglio: sabato 12: al Nord nuvoloso; al Centro soleggiato; al Sud soleggiato. domenica 13: al Nord nubi irregolari; al Centro via via pi√π nuvoloso; al Sud bel tempo. luned√¨ 14: al Nord piovaschi a ovest; al Centro poco nuvoloso; al Sud bel tempo..

title: Conflicto en Altec: el duro documento de UPCN R\u00edo Negro por los recortes de salarios
text:
Conflicto en Altec: el duro documento de UPCN R√≠o Negro por los recortes de salarios
Los trabajadores de la empresa estatal denuncian una p√©rdida de poder adquisitivo y un "clima laboral deteriorado".
[https://www.rionegro.com.ar/gremios/conflicto-en-altec-el-duro-documento-de-upcn-rio-negro-por-los-recortes-de-salarios-3904883/]
Desde el gremio UPCN emitieron un duro documento respecto a la actual situaci√≥n de los trabajadores de la [empresa estatal rionegrina Altec](https://www.rionegro.com.ar/politica/igual-que-invap-rio-negro-transforma-otras-empresas-publicas-en-sociedades-anonimas-3896724/). Denunciaron recortes salariales y ¬´un clima laboral deteriorado¬ª.
Este viernes habr√° una asamblea de trabajadores para definir posibles medidas, en caso de no obtener prontas novedades desde el directorio.
Seg√∫n expusieron, la situaci√≥n se acentu√≥ en el √∫ltimo a√±o a ra√≠z de los cambios en el contexto macroecon√≥mico del pa√≠s. ¬´Para nosotros fue una p√©rdida de poder adquisitivo bastante grande y a todo eso se sum√≥ que no tuvimos una compensaci√≥n, como si se produjo en otros organismos. Quedamos muy atr√°s y solo pedimos una recomposici√≥n antes de fin de a√±o¬´, coment√≥ Federico Fontana, delegado de UPCN, en di√°logo con Diario R√çO NEGRO.
Estimaron que el atraso salarial se ronda el 75% respecto a la inflaci√≥n acumulada en el a√±o. Asimismo el sindicato report√≥ que el 45% del salario no realiza aportes previsionales.
Desde UPCN precisaron, adem√°s, que la nueva presidencia de Altec implement√≥ medidas que provocaron ¬´una grave crisis laboral y financiera para los empleados¬ª. Entre ellas, se mencion√≥ la reducci√≥n de los costos de los servicios ofrecidos, lo que implic√≥ una considerable baja en los ingresos y su posterior impacto en los sueldos.
[El Gobierno de R√≠o Negro aplica cambios en Altec para su plan modernizador](https://www.rionegro.com.ar/politica/el-gobierno-de-rio-negro-aplica-cambios-en-altec-para-su-plan-modernizador-3575387/)
¬´Se redujeron los valores de los contratos, lo que gener√≥ un ahorra a los organismos del Estado que tienen adquiridos los servicios de Altec. El sueldo se mantuvo en los mismos niveles, pero no habilit√≥ a aumentos para equilibrar la situaci√≥n con la inflaci√≥n¬ª, expres√≥ Fontana.
Seg√∫n estimaciones de los trabajadores, esta reducci√≥n de ingresos implic√≥ una p√©rdida de 700 mil pesos mensuales por cada uno de los 190 empleados. Este n√∫mero representar√≠a una ¬´p√©rdida total que supera los $1.300 mil millones entre todos los trabajadores¬ª.
En ese contexto, unas 20 personas decidieron dejar la compa√±√≠a en 2024 como consecuencia. ¬´Con mejores ofertas en el sector privado, estos trabajadores no ven razones para permanecer en una empresa que no valora su esfuerzo. Esta p√©rdida ha incrementado la carga laboral de quienes se quedan, afectando tanto la moral como el rendimiento general de la empresa¬´, agregaron en el escrito de UPCN.
Malestar interno en Altec: el cambio a sociedad an√≥nima
El gobierno de R√≠o Negro decidi√≥ acoplarse a la manda del DNU 70/23, firmado en diciembre pasado por el presidente Javier Milei, y transformar sus empresas estatales en sociedades an√≥nimas, un proceso que ya avanz√≥ en Invap y ahora tambi√©n se acelera en Altec.
Este cambio gener√≥ desconcierto entre los empleados, quienes denunciaron ¬´falta de comunicaci√≥n y reconocimiento por parte de la actual gesti√≥n¬ª. ¬´Desde la empresa no se traslado informaci√≥n y es lo que se estaba pidiendo: que se explique en qu√© va a repercutir¬ª, agreg√≥ Fontana.
Seg√∫n advirtieron desde UPCN, el gremio permanece ¬´abierto al di√°logo¬ª y mantiene la esperanza de destrabar el conflicto. En tanto, los empleados ya est√°n planificando una nueva asamblea, que podr√≠a determinar eventuales medidas de fuerza.

text: Um im√£ tunisiano expulso na quinta-feira (22) pela Fran√ßa, onde as autoridades o acusam de ter feito apologia ao √≥dio, denunciou em uma declara√ß√£o oficial uma decis√£o "injusta" e "arbitr√°ria", e anunciou que tomar√° medidas legais para anul√°-la e voltar para sua fam√≠lia, que continua em terras francesas. Mahjoub Mahjoubi, o im√£ da pequena cidade de Bagnols-sur-C√®ze, no sul da [Fran√ßa](https://www.rfi.fr/br/tag/fran√ßa/), foi preso e deportado na quinta-feira (22) para a [Tun√≠sia](https://www.rfi.fr/br/tag/tun√≠sia/), onde chegou pouco antes da meia-noite em um voo saindo de Paris. O im√£ [nome dado aos pregadores da religi√£o isl√¢mica], que vive na Fran√ßa desde meados da d√©cada de 1980, √© casado e tem cinco filhos, e estava na mira do ministro do Interior da Fran√ßa, G√©rald Darmanin, que pediu a retirada de sua autoriza√ß√£o de resid√™ncia na Fran√ßa no domingo. Mahjoub Mahjoubi foi acusado, em particular, de transmitir um v√≠deo no qual descreveu a "bandeira tricolor" - sem especificar se mencionava na ocasi√£o a bandeira francesa - como uma "bandeira sat√¢nica" que n√£o teria "nenhum valor aos olhos de Al√°" (Deus em √°rabe). Ele se defendeu referindo-se a um "lapso de linguagem", explicando que, na verdade, estava denunciando rivalidades entre torcedores de pa√≠ses do Magrebe (no norte da [√Åfrica](https://www.rfi.fr/br/tag/√°frica/)) durante o recente torneio de futebol da Copa das Na√ß√µes Africanas ( [CAN](https://www.rfi.fr/br/tag/can/)). "Vou me defender e fazer tudo o que puder para voltar para minha esposa e meus filhos", disse ele da casa de seus sogros em Soliman, a cerca de 30 km a leste de T√∫nis. Sua esposa e filhos, o mais novo dos quais est√° hospitalizado com c√¢ncer, dependem inteiramente dele, enfatizou o im√£, que tamb√©m √© chefe de uma empresa de constru√ß√£o, acrescentando: "Sou apenas um contribuinte, um homem sem problemas". "Meu advogado vai me levar ao tribunal na Fran√ßa e, se o tribunal n√£o me fizer justi√ßa, vou recorrer e, depois, recorrerei √† Corte Europeia de [Direitos Humanos](https://www.rfi.fr/br/tag/direitos-humanos/)", acrescentou. "Decis√£o arbitr√°ria" O im√£ de 52 anos, cuja esposa e filhos s√£o cidad√£os franceses, disse que "acreditava e tinha confian√ßa no sistema judici√°rio franc√™s, que [o ministro do Interior da Fran√ßa, G√©rard] Darmanin assumiu". "N√£o h√° d√∫vida de que uma injusti√ßa foi cometida contra mim, a lei de imigra√ß√£o foi aprovada h√° cerca de tr√™s semanas, e eu sou a primeira v√≠tima dessa lei", disse o im√£. Darmanin disse no X nesta quinta-feira que a expuls√£o do im√£ era "prova de que a lei de imigra√ß√£o (recentemente aprovada), [sem a qual uma expuls√£o t√£o r√°pida n√£o teria sido poss√≠vel](https://www.rfi.fr/br/fran√ßa/20231219-lei-de-imigra√ß√£o-conhe√ßa-os-principais-pontos-do-acordo-pol√™mico-votado-na-fran√ßa), torna a Fran√ßa mais forte". "A firmeza √© a regra", acrescentou o ministro franc√™s, denunciando um "im√£ radical" cujas observa√ß√µes eram inaceit√°veis. Negando categoricamente qualquer "insulto √† comunidade judaica ou √† bandeira francesa", ele disse que as autoridades de sua cidade o conheciam como "um homem de paz, equilibrado". "Nunca defendi o √≥dio ou o radicalismo - pelo contr√°rio, todos me conhecem", acrescentou. "Minha expuls√£o foi resultado de uma decis√£o arbitr√°ria do Ministro do Interior. Darmanin est√° tentando criar um burburinho em torno da lei de imigra√ß√£o usando Mahjoub Mahjoubi", retrucou o im√£, enfatizando a rapidez da decis√£o de expuls√£o. Mahjoubi acrescentou: "Darmanin est√° coletando apoiadores no [partido de extrema direita] Reuni√£o Nacional, com as elei√ß√µes europeias chegando" em junho, num momento em que √µ partido governista est√° atr√°s do RN nas pesquisas. (Com AFP)

author: Ryan Ward
title: Raiders Troll Patrick Mahomes With Puppet At Camp
text:
There‚Äôs no love lost between teams in the AFC West division, as most of the teams within the division hate their divisional opponents every single year, which makes for some interesting matchups during the NFL regular season.
Although the back-to-back Super Bowl champion Kansas City Chiefs have been the cream of the crop in the division since Patrick Mahomes took over at quarterback, the Las Vegas Raiders have sometimes given them a run for their money, kicking that rivalry back into high gear.
Last year, the Raiders lost to Mahomes and company during the Thanksgiving Day weekend but got some revenge on Christmas Day by beating the Chiefs on the road at GEHA Field at Arrowhead Stadium.
Mahomes admitted that the loss to the Raiders on Christmas was a big blow and a game he wished had gone the other way, while Las Vegas reveled in getting the last laugh, even though they ended up missing the playoffs.
With the tension between the Raiders and Chiefs, it has become a storyline ahead of the 2024 NFL season and now has been taken to another level with a Kermit the Frog doll dressed up as Mahomes making the rounds during training camp in Costa Mesa via Ari Meirov of The 33rd Team.
